arm_group.description: Patients with a history of lumbosacral radiculopathy or lumbar herniated nucleus pulposus, scheduled for Transforaminal Epidural Steroid Injection.

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to describe the contrast flow patterns in the epidural space
      using the inferior-anterior approach with continuous fluoroscopic guidance, and determine
      how well this approach correlates with appropriate contrast flow patterns and with analgesia
      at follow up. This knowledge may prove useful in guiding physician practice patterns in the
      non-surgical management of low back pain.

      Hypothesis:  The investigators hypothesize that there will be suitable (ventral/anterior)
      epidural contrast spread based on inferior-anterior needle-tip position, particularly with
      appropriate needle tip position.

clinical_study.brief_title: Epidural Contrast Flow Patterns of TESI Using the Inferior-Anterior Position as the Final Needle Tip Position.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  18 years of age or older

          -  History of lumbosacral radiculopathy or lumbar herniated nucleus pulposus

          -  Scheduled for TFESI at GW Spine and Pain Center

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Pregnant or plan on becoming pregnant

          -  Have undergone TFESI in the past year

          -  Opioid habituation

          -  Lumbo-sacral stenosis

          -  Lumbar surgery

          -  Lumbar spondylolisthesis

study_pop.textblock: George Washington Spine and Pain Center patients.

facility.name: George Washington Spine and Pain Center

clinical_study.official_title: Epidural Contrast Flow Patterns of Transforaminal Epidural Steroid Injections Using the Inferior-Anterior Position as the Final Needle Tip Position.

overall_official.affiliation: George Washington Spine and Pain Center

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

primary_outcome.description: Contrast flow patterns will be used as the primary outcome measure.  The statistical test to be employed is to compare the proportions of patients in the study who experienced posterior flow, anterior flow and if that anterior flow had spread to more than 1 vertebral level in either direction, what that direction was, and the presence or absence of vascular flow.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

responsible_party.investigator_title: Director of the George Washington Spine and Pain Center

secondary_outcome.description: VAS Pain Score - The statistical test to be employed is Wilcoxon Signed Rank Test to compare if there is a difference in pain score at appointments 1 months and 3 months post-injection relative to pre-injection.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective
